newsitem.title: JAPAN: Aramco's Ras Tanura A-180 premium doubles - traders.
newsitem.headline: Aramco's Ras Tanura A-180 premium doubles - traders.

text.p: Importers of Saudi Arabia's term naphtha cargoes have accepted the supplier's offer price of $6.50 over the Aramco formula for A-180 naphtha for the first half of 1997, traders said on Tuesday.
The price is applied to A-180 cargoes lifted at Ras Tanura on the Persian Gulf coast, they said.
The new price compares with a current premium of $3.40 for the July-December period.
The premium for Jubail-produced naphtha was raised by $2.50 to $5.50 for the same period, they added.
Japan and South Korea lift 2.2 to 2.5 million tonnes of A-180 cargoes a year at Ras Tanura on a term basis, traders said.
